name: Loco-coco
description:
This is a homebrought game, run on Gameboy Color. Original version: Don Rigby - Illusion Software Ltd., Commodore 16/Plus4, 1986. Created with GB-Studio 2.0.0 beta5!

Also available for download in .CIA format for the Nintendo 3DS virtual console!

O.K. so Lionel could not tell the difference between a Bo-Bo or a Co-Co but when the guard of the 5.15 to Victoria rushed screaming through his compartment he knew it didn't matter what sort of Locomotive it was, something was wrong. 

When the Guard had recovered sufficently he was able to gasp out that the locomotive was out of control hurtling down a steep incline. The driver was apparently unconscious since the Guard could not raise him on the intercom.

"Loco" Lionel known to millions of cinema goers as a leading Hollywood Stuntman realised this was a job for him. Now alone, clinging to the roof of a speeding coach he wonders whether or not he wasn't too hasty. Its up to you to make his perilous journey successful.

There are 12 screens in the game. Lionel has to use his skill and daring to manouver over the roof of each one.

To complete a screen walk off the left hand of the screen. When Lionel reaches the Locomotive he earn the undying gratitude of his fellow passengers.

Move: Cursor LEFT/RIGHT
Jump up: B
Lie down: Cursor DOWN   

Move: Arrow keys - LEFT/RIGHT
Jump up: X
Lie down: Arrow keys - DOWN

Loco-coco - Illusion Software Ltd.

Creators webpage (WLS): Loco-coco
